abstract: General Electric reports third-quarter profit of $3.2 billion, or 31 cents per share, up 57 percent from year-ago quarter; revenue was $35.4 billion, flat from year-ago quarter.
snippet: General Electric’s net earnings rose 57 percent compared to 2010, but much of the increase was due to a one-time charge in 2010 related to the consumer finance unit in Japan.
lead_paragraph: General Electric’s net earnings rose 57 percent compared to 2010, but much of the increase was due to a one-time charge in 2010 related to the consumer finance unit in Japan.

headline.main: G.E. Profits Are in Line With Analysts’ Outlook
headline.print_headline: G.E. Profits Are in Line With Analysts’ Outlook
headline.seo: G.E. Reports an Increase in Profits and Meets Analysts’ Expectations
